clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial in Liver Transplant Recipients Treated in Steroid Sparing Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: Steroid Avoidance in Hep C OLT

brief_summary.textblock: Liver transplant subjects will be given Mycophenolate (MMF) and Tacrolimus in order to help prevent post-transplant rejection.

detailed_description.textblock: Recurrent HCV in the liver allograft is becoming the leading indicator for retransplantation. Studies suggest that glucocorticord-based immunosuppression regimens hasten the onset and progression of recurrent chronic HCV liver disease. Treatment of acute allograft rejection with steroid boluses is also associated with rapid HCV recurrence. The relative contribution of various calcineurin inhibitors to recurrent HCV liver disease has not been established. Previous retrospective studies, as well as prospective studies have not demonstrated a difference in recurrent HCV liver disease rates between patients receiving CsA or tacrolimus immunosuppression regimens respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: compare timing & severity of recurrent chronic HCV disease Neoral versus Prograf

secondary_outcome.measure: compare the effectiveness of Neoral with Prograf as primary immunotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients who have received liver transplant
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women
- nursing women
